introduction.title: Our Ethical Commitment
content: At News Portal, we are committed to the highest standards of ethical conduct and professional integrity. This Ethics Policy outlines the principles and standards that guide our behavior and decision-making.

Our ethical standards apply to all employees, contractors, contributors, and anyone representing News Portal. We believe that maintaining trust with our audience, sources, and partners requires unwavering commitment to ethical principles.
This policy is not exhaustive but provides a framework for ethical decision-making. When faced with ethical dilemmas, we encourage consultation with supervisors, editors, or our ethics committee.

sections.title: Core Ethical Values
content: Our ethics policy is built on fundamental values that guide all our actions:

subsections.title: Integrity
subsections.content: We act with honesty and honor in all our dealings. We do what is right, not what is easy or convenient.
items: Tell the truth, even when it's difficult
Admit mistakes and take responsibility
Keep promises and commitments
Be honest in all communications
Maintain consistency between words and actions

subsections.title: Independence
subsections.content: We maintain independence from influences that could compromise our judgment or objectivity.
items: Make decisions based on facts and merit
Resist pressure from external sources
Avoid conflicts of interest
Maintain editorial independence
Protect our autonomy and credibility

subsections.title: Accountability
subsections.content: We take responsibility for our actions and their consequences.
items: Accept responsibility for our work
Correct errors promptly and transparently
Answer for our decisions and actions
Hold ourselves to high standards
Learn from mistakes and improve

subsections.title: Respect
subsections.content: We treat all individuals with dignity and respect, regardless of their position or circumstances.
items: Respect the rights and dignity of all people
Listen to diverse perspectives
Treat sources and subjects fairly
Show empathy and compassion
Value diversity and inclusion

subsections.title: Transparency
subsections.content: We are open about our methods, motivations, and potential conflicts.
items: Disclose relevant information
Be clear about our processes
Explain our decisions when appropriate
Acknowledge limitations
Share information openly and honestly

sections.title: Conflicts of Interest
content: A conflict of interest occurs when personal interests could compromise professional judgment. We must identify, disclose, and manage all potential conflicts.

subsections.title: Financial Conflicts
subsections.content: We avoid financial interests that could influence our work or create the appearance of bias.
items: Do not cover companies or industries in which you have financial investments
Disclose any financial interests relevant to your coverage area
Do not trade stocks or securities based on unpublished information
Avoid business relationships with sources or subjects of coverage
Do not accept loans or financial benefits from sources

subsections.title: Personal Relationships
subsections.content: Personal relationships can create conflicts when they involve people or organizations we cover.
items: Do not cover family members, romantic partners, or close friends
Disclose personal relationships relevant to your work
Recuse yourself from stories involving personal connections
Avoid socializing with sources in ways that could compromise objectivity
Maintain professional boundaries with sources

subsections.title: Political & Advocacy Activities
subsections.content: Political activities and advocacy can compromise actual or perceived objectivity.
items: Do not engage in political activism or campaigning
Avoid public displays of political preference
Do not hold political office while employed as a journalist
Refrain from signing petitions or joining advocacy organizations related to coverage areas
Maintain neutrality in public forums and social media

subsections.title: Outside Employment & Activities
items: Disclose all outside employment and professional activities
Obtain approval before accepting outside work
Ensure outside activities do not conflict with your role
Do not use your position for personal gain
Avoid activities that could compromise your credibility

sections.title: Gifts, Hospitality & Benefits
content: Accepting gifts, meals, travel, or other benefits from sources or subjects of coverage can create conflicts of interest and compromise independence.

subsections.title: Gift Policy
items: Do not accept gifts of significant value (generally $25 or more)
Decline gifts from sources, subjects, or anyone seeking to influence coverage
Return or donate gifts that cannot be refused
Do not accept cash or cash equivalents under any circumstances
Promotional items and samples must be returned or shared with the team
Disclose any gifts received that cannot be returned

subsections.title: Meals & Entertainment
items: Pay your own way whenever possible
Accept modest meals only when necessary for newsgathering
Do not accept lavish entertainment or hospitality
Split checks or take turns paying when dining with regular sources
Decline invitations to events unrelated to legitimate news coverage

subsections.title: Travel & Accommodations
items: News Portal pays for all travel and accommodations when possible
Accept travel/accommodation from news sources only when absolutely necessary
Disclose when travel or accommodation is provided by others
Maintain editorial independence regardless of who pays for travel
Do not accept free or discounted travel for personal use

subsections.title: Awards & Prizes
items: Decline awards that come with significant monetary value from organizations you cover
Disclose all professional awards and their sponsors
Do not allow awards to influence coverage
Evaluate whether accepting an award creates a conflict of interest

sections.title: Relationships with Sources
content: Ethical relationships with sources are built on honesty, respect, and professional boundaries.

subsections.title: Source Honesty
items: Always identify yourself as a journalist
Be clear about your purpose when contacting sources
Do not misrepresent yourself or your intentions
Explain how information will be used
Honor agreements about attribution and confidentiality

subsections.title: Confidential Sources
subsections.content: Protecting confidential sources is a serious ethical and sometimes legal obligation.
items: Only promise confidentiality when necessary for important stories
Obtain editor approval before granting confidentiality
Clearly define the terms of confidentiality
Keep confidences even under legal pressure
Never reveal a source's identity without their permission
Maintain secure records of confidential source communications

subsections.title: Source Relationships
items: Maintain professional distance from sources
Do not develop personal relationships that could compromise objectivity
Avoid socializing with sources outside of professional contexts
Do not promise favorable coverage
Treat all sources with respect and fairness

subsections.title: Payment for Information
items: Do not pay sources for news information
Do not pay for interviews or access
Legitimate expenses (travel, document fees) may be reimbursed with approval
Disclose if any payment or benefit was provided to a source

sections.title: Accuracy & Truthfulness
content: Accuracy and truthfulness are the foundation of journalistic ethics. We strive for accuracy in every aspect of our work.

subsections.title: Verification Standards
items: Verify all information before publication
Use multiple independent sources when possible
Distinguish between what we know and what we believe
Clearly identify unverified information
Check the accuracy of names, dates, quotes, and facts
Correct errors immediately and transparently

subsections.title: Fabrication & Plagiarism
subsections.content: Fabrication and plagiarism are among the most serious ethical violations.
items: Never fabricate information, quotes, or sources
Never present another's work as your own
Always attribute information to its source
Use quotation marks for direct quotes
Paraphrase properly while crediting the source
Violations result in immediate termination

subsections.title: Manipulation & Deception
items: Do not manipulate photos, videos, or audio to mislead
Do not take quotes out of context to change meaning
Do not omit key information that would alter understanding
Be transparent about limitations in our knowledge
Do not use deceptive newsgathering techniques except in rare, approved cases

sections.title: Fairness & Impartiality
content: We strive to be fair and impartial in our coverage, presenting information without bias or prejudice.

subsections.title: Balanced Coverage
items: Present all relevant sides of controversial issues
Give subjects of criticism an opportunity to respond
Seek out diverse perspectives
Challenge claims from all sides equally
Avoid loaded or biased language
Distinguish between news coverage and opinion

subsections.title: Avoiding Bias
items: Examine your own biases and assumptions
Do not let personal views influence coverage
Be aware of unconscious bias
Seek diverse voices and perspectives
Question your assumptions
Accept feedback about potential bias

subsections.title: Right of Reply
items: Give people criticized in our coverage a chance to respond
Provide adequate time for response before publication
Include substantive responses prominently in the story
Be fair even to those who decline to comment
Note when individuals cannot be reached or decline to comment

sections.title: Privacy & Human Dignity
content: We respect privacy and treat all individuals with dignity, especially vulnerable populations.

subsections.title: Privacy Rights
items: Respect individuals' reasonable expectations of privacy
Balance privacy interests against public interest
Be especially careful with private matters of public figures
Do not intrude on private grief without compelling justification
Obtain consent before entering private property
Consider the long-term impact of publishing personal information

subsections.title: Vulnerable Individuals
subsections.content: Special care must be taken when covering vulnerable populations.
items: Protect the identity of minors in sensitive stories
Be sensitive when covering victims of crime or tragedy
Consider mental capacity when interviewing vulnerable individuals
Protect the identity of sexual assault victims
Be careful when covering individuals with mental illness
Show compassion for those experiencing trauma or grief

subsections.title: Informed Consent
items: Ensure interviewees understand how information will be used
Obtain consent before recording conversations where required by law
Get permission before photographing people in private settings
Explain potential consequences of participating in stories
Respect when people withdraw consent (where legally possible)

sections.title: Minimizing Harm
content: While we pursue truth and serve the public interest, we seek to minimize unnecessary harm.

subsections.title: Balancing Public Interest & Harm
items: Consider whether publication serves a legitimate public interest
Weigh the public's need to know against potential harm
Use the least harmful means to obtain and report information
Consider whether the same story can be told with less harm
Be transparent about why sensitive information is being published

subsections.title: Graphic Content
items: Avoid gratuitous use of graphic images or descriptions
Provide warnings for disturbing content
Consider the impact on victims, families, and audiences
Ask whether graphic details serve a journalistic purpose
Respect the dignity of deceased individuals

subsections.title: Sensitive Topics
subsections.content: Extra care is required when covering sensitive topics like suicide, sexual assault, or violence.
items: Follow guidelines for reporting on suicide to avoid contagion
Protect the identity of sexual assault victims
Avoid graphic descriptions of violence unless necessary
Provide resources and hotlines for affected individuals
Consider the impact on families and communities
Be sensitive to cultural and religious considerations

sections.title: Independence & Integrity
content: We maintain independence from commercial, political, and other external pressures.

subsections.title: Editorial Independence
items: Editorial decisions are based solely on journalistic merit
Resist pressure from advertisers, sponsors, or powerful interests
Maintain separation between editorial and commercial operations
Do not allow business relationships to influence coverage
Report stories based on public interest, not commercial interest

subsections.title: Commercial Pressure
items: Do not promise coverage in exchange for advertising
Clearly label sponsored content
Maintain editorial standards for all content
Do not allow advertisers to review stories before publication
Report on advertisers and business partners fairly

subsections.title: Political Independence
items: Maintain independence from political parties and movements
Do not accept direction from political figures or organizations
Cover all political actors fairly and without bias
Resist pressure from government or political interests
Maintain separation from advocacy organizations

sections.title: Digital & Social Media Ethics
content: Digital platforms present unique ethical challenges that require careful consideration.

subsections.title: Social Media Conduct
items: Maintain professional standards on social media
Avoid expressing political bias on social platforms
Verify information before sharing
Identify yourself as a News Portal journalist
Respect embargoes and confidential information online
Engage respectfully with audiences
Do not harass or attack others online

subsections.title: User-Generated Content
items: Verify authenticity of user-generated content
Obtain permission before using social media content
Credit sources appropriately
Be aware of potential manipulation or misinformation
Consider privacy implications of sharing user content

subsections.title: Online Privacy & Security
items: Protect source communications with encryption
Secure sensitive information appropriately
Be aware of digital surveillance risks
Use secure methods for receiving confidential information
Protect sources who may face digital threats

sections.title: Diversity, Equity & Inclusion
content: We are committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion in our workplace and our coverage.

subsections.title: Inclusive Coverage
items: Seek diverse sources and perspectives
Cover underrepresented communities fairly and accurately
Avoid stereotypes and generalizations
Be sensitive to cultural differences
Consider whose voices are missing from stories
Challenge systemic bias in coverage

subsections.title: Inclusive Language
items: Use gender-neutral language when appropriate
Respect individuals' preferred names and pronouns
Use person-first language for disabilities when appropriate
Avoid racist, sexist, or discriminatory language
Be precise rather than using broad generalizations
Consult style guides and affected communities

subsections.title: Workplace Inclusion
items: Treat all colleagues with respect and dignity
Value diverse perspectives and experiences
Speak up against discrimination or harassment
Support inclusive hiring and promotion practices
Participate in diversity and inclusion training
Create a welcoming environment for all

sections.title: Workplace Conduct
content: We maintain professional standards of conduct in the workplace.

subsections.title: Professional Behavior
items: Treat colleagues with respect and professionalism
Communicate clearly and honestly
Meet deadlines and commitments
Collaborate effectively with team members
Accept constructive feedback graciously
Maintain confidentiality of proprietary information

subsections.title: Harassment & Discrimination
subsections.content: We have zero tolerance for harassment or discrimination of any kind.
items: Do not engage in sexual harassment or misconduct
Do not discriminate based on protected characteristics
Report harassment or discrimination immediately
Support colleagues who experience harassment
Participate in anti-harassment training
Create a safe and respectful work environment

subsections.title: Substance Use
items: Do not use alcohol or drugs in ways that impair work performance
Do not come to work under the influence
Do not use illegal substances
Seek help for substance abuse issues
Support colleagues dealing with substance issues

sections.title: Legal & Regulatory Compliance
content: We comply with all applicable laws and regulations while pursuing our journalistic mission.

subsections.title: Media Law
items: Understand and comply with defamation law
Respect copyright and intellectual property rights
Follow court reporting restrictions when applicable
Comply with privacy laws and regulations
Understand shield laws and reporter's privilege
Consult legal counsel for complex legal issues

subsections.title: Regulatory Compliance
items: Comply with employment laws and regulations
Follow financial reporting requirements
Adhere to data protection regulations
Comply with advertising and disclosure regulations
Follow safety and health regulations

sections.title: Reporting Ethics Violations
content: We encourage reporting of ethical concerns and protect those who raise issues in good faith.

subsections.title: How to Report
items: Speak with your supervisor or editor
Contact the ethics committee
Email ethics@newsportal.com
Use the anonymous ethics hotline
Report to Human Resources
Reports can be made anonymously

subsections.title: Investigation Process
items: All reports are taken seriously and investigated
Investigations are conducted promptly and fairly
Confidentiality is maintained to the extent possible
Both parties are given an opportunity to provide information
Appropriate action is taken based on findings
Follow-up is provided to the extent possible

subsections.title: Non-Retaliation
subsections.content: We prohibit retaliation against anyone who reports ethical concerns in good faith.
items: No adverse action for good faith reports
Retaliation is itself an ethics violation
Report any suspected retaliation immediately
Protection extends to witnesses and participants
False or malicious reports are not protected

content: If you have questions about this Ethics Policy or need to report an ethics concern, please contact:

acknowledgment.title: Acknowledgment & Commitment
acknowledgment.content: All team members are required to read, understand, and comply with this Ethics Policy. By working with News Portal, you acknowledge your commitment to upholding these ethical standards and agree to conduct yourself in accordance with these principles.
